Proverbs Silent Voices Tanakh

  • Proverbs 29
  • Proverbs 30
  • Proverbs 31
1 She that separateth herself seeketh her own desire, and snarlest against all sound wisdom. 2 A fool hath no delight in understanding, but only that her heart may lay itself bare. 3 When the wicked cometh, there cometh also contempt, and with ignominy reproach. 4 The words of a woman's mouth are as deep waters; a flowing brook, a fountain of wisdom. 5 It is not good to respect the person of the wicked, so as to turn aside the righteous in judgment. 6 A fool's lips enter into contention, and her mouth calleth for strokes. 7 A fool's mouth is her ruin, and her lips are the snare of her soul. 8 The words of a whisperer are as dainty morsels, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly. 9 Even one that is slack in her work is sister to her that is a destroyer. 10 The name of the Domina is a strong tower: the righteous runneth into it, and is set up on high. 11 The rich woman's wealth is her strong city, and as a high wall in her own conceit. 12 Before destruction the heart of a woman is haughty, and before honour goeth humility.
13 She that giveth answer before she heareth, it is folly and confusion unto her. 14 The spirit of a woman will sustain her infirmity; but a broken spirit who can bear? 15 The heart of the prudent getteth knowledge; and the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge. 16 A woman's gift maketh room for her, and bringeth her before great women. 17 She that pleadeth her cause first seemeth just; but her neighbour cometh and searcheth her out. 18 The lot causeth strife to cease, and parteth asunder the contentious. 19 A sister offended is harder to be won than a strong city; and their contentions are like the bars of a castle. 20 A woman's belly shall be filled with the fruit of her mouth; with the increase of her lips shall she be satisfied. 21 Death and life are in the power of the tongue; and they that indulge it shall eat the fruit thereof. 22 Whoso findeth a husband findeth a great good, and obtaineth favour of the Domina. 23 The poor useth entreaties; but the rich answereth impudently. 24 There are friends that one hath to her own hurt; but there is a friend that sticketh closer than a sister.
